page.title: 05Ecology in Llangunllo
page.content: The ancient{Hedges}consist of a mixture of elderberry, thorn, oak, ash, briar, bramble, willow, hazel, currant, gooseberry, holly and honeysuckle.They provide cover and food for moles, shrews, field mice, weasles, stoats, squirrels (grey) and hedgehogs.Slowworms, frogs, toads, lizards and newts live in the undegrowth.{Birds}nesting include the tit_mice famalies as well as robins, chaffinches, dunnocks, blackbirds and sparrow_hawks.{Wild flowers}abound including water wrens, vaterian, meadow_sweet, violets, primroses and wild stawberries.The woods harbour badgers, foxes and polecats, herons, buzzards, magpies, jays, treecreepers, nut_hatches and woodpeckers. Kingfishers, mallards and waterhens are found near the trout bearing river.Owls and bats are numerous
